page.title: 05Living in Southfields
page.content: Around the tube station are shops including florists, grocers and some clothes shops, but there is no super- market. THe pet shop sells supplies but not pets.Indian people own most of the shops but Daley Thompson's brother owns one. There are no pubs because Quakers own the land who do not like drinking. There are no factories so it is fairly quiet, except when Wimbledon Tennis comes.Lots of taxis are about then and lots of stalls open up selling Wimbledon T-shirts.Fifty years ago there was farming land now a housing estate.There is a boys' club next to the Post Office and there is also a Cubs group.There is one Bingo Hall and at the top of Augustus Rd St. Paul's Anglican church has a youth club.During Sunday Services children can play in a separate room.
